DataElement.preferredName: RT Beam Control Point DICOM Sequence of Items Text
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Introduces sequence of beam control points for current treatment beam. One or more Items shall be included in this sequence.   See C.8.8.21.1.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Radiation Therapy Beam Control Point Sequence
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Treatment of a disease by means of exposure of the target or the whole body to radiation. Radiation therapy is often used as part of curative therapy and occasionally as a component of palliative treatment for cancer. Other uses include total body irradiation prior to transplantation._A group of nearly parallel rays of electromagnetic radiation or a stream of particles._Any one of a set of linear accelerator parameters that define the segments from which a radiation beam is applied._How much there is of something that you can measure; the total amount or number._Sequence; serial arrangement in which things follow in logical order or a recurrent pattern.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Treatment of a disease by means of exposure of the target or the whole body to radiation. Radiation therapy is often used as part of curative therapy and occasionally as a component of palliative treatment for cancer. Other uses include total body irradiation prior to transplantation.:A group of nearly parallel rays of electromagnetic radiation or a stream of particles.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Events, people, materials and activities uniquely defined by medical imaging.
ConceptualDomain.origin: DICOM:Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine

DataElementConcept.origin: DICOM:Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine
DataElementConcept.changeDescription: 11/18/19 jk DICOM CDE; Released per qtrly metric review.  12/16/13 created for a Norton (NCI) DICOM RT study. jc

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: SQ: Text used to describe named areas of the body as an order set of zero to 'n' values referenced by ordinal position starting with 1 as defined in the 2007 DICOM, Part 5, Paragraph 7.5 Nesting of Data Sets. Size of text may be an Explicit Length or variable Undefined Length.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Events, people, materials and activities uniquely defined by medical imaging.
ConceptualDomain.origin: DICOM:Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Sequence; serial arrangement in which things follow in logical order or a recurrent pattern.:A group of items of the same type, gathered for display or study.:Text; the words of something written.

Concepts.definition: A serial arrangement in which things follow in logical order or a recurrent pattern.
A group of items of the same type, gathered for display or study.

ValueDomain.origin: DICOM:Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine
ValueDomain.changeDescription: 11/20/13 datatype changed to charater to support OCI. jc  2/11/09 released because VD used in NCIA DE to be released.  8/21/07-DICOM SQ value representation type for DICOM which has a variable size

ReferenceDocuments.name: DICOM Note
ReferenceDocuments.description: DICOM PS-3.3 C.8.8.21.1 Control point machine delivery parameters All treatment machine delivery parameters (including table angles and positions) in the RT Treatment Session Record Module shall be specified as absolute, not relative, values at the Control Point.

ReferenceDocuments.name: DICOM Reference
ReferenceDocuments.description: PS 3.3-2011: Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine (DICOM), Part 3: Information Object Definitions
